meanings.definition: To place or arrange in a certain location or position.
meanings.sent1: I am colocating my books on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The students are colocating their desks in a neat row.
meanings.sent3: The chef was colocating the spices with precision.
meanings.sent4: The birds were colocating on the power lines, creating a symmetrical pattern.
meanings.sent5: She was colocating the flowers in the vase, creating a beautiful arrangement.

meanings.definition: To be situated in close proximity to each other.
meanings.sent1: The houses are colocating along the street.
meanings.sent2: The trees are colocating in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were colocating on the couch, arguing over the remote.
meanings.sent4: The stars were colocating in the night sky, forming constellations.
meanings.sent5: The cars were colocating in the parking lot, filling up the spaces.
